page.title: 06HURLFORD/CROOKEDHOLM CLUBS.
page.content: Hurlford Community Centre was built in 1974. Here's a list of the activities held at the Community Centre. There are meetings, games, nightclubs, discos, garden clubs, dancing and Majorettes. The Community Centre can seat up to 350 people at plays and can hold up to 300 people at discos.The centre is made of wood and brick.Ayr County Council built the centre and it took quite a while.Strathclyde own the Community Centre and it is the only one in Strathclyde to have two caretakers and one cleaner. There are playgroups every Tuesday and Thursday. Local councillors visit the centres frequently. There are tea mornings held daily and a chidrens' games night weekly. Crookedholm Community Centre is similarly organised. The local school has its main assemblies there.
